english: Xi’an city; capital of Shaanxi Province

etymology.description: 西(西) (xī, "west") + 安(安) (ān, "peace") = Xi’an is historically the western gateway to China and has been a peaceful and significant cultural hub.
etymology.interpretation: The name Xi’an reflects its historical position as a western capital and symbol of peace in China. The city has a long history of serving as a capital for several Chinese dynasties and is known for its cultural and historical significance, such as being the starting point of the Silk Road.

examples.chinese: 我打算今年去西安(西安)。
examples.english: I plan to visit Xi’an this year.

examples.chinese: 老师说西安(西安)，是一个历史名城(歷史名城)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī shuō Xī’ān, shì yīgè lìshǐ míngchéng.
examples.english: The teacher said that Xi’an is a historic city.

examples.chinese: 我们参观了西安(西安)，体会古城魅力(體會古城魅力)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen cānguānle Xī’ān, tǐhuì gǔchéng mèilì.
examples.english: We visited Xi’an and experienced the charm of the ancient city.
